reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to our suite, the Mystic Water suite (one bedroom) and were thrilled by what we saw! The website didn't have photos when we booked it so we went on Tracy's recommendation and we were so happy we did. It was incredible!!! The view from the suite and pool were incredible! The unit was just perfect....I don't know how else to describe it. The kitchen was perfect, our own private little pool, and a fantastic indoor/outdoor shower. The unit was so nice and comfortable and relaxing, we felt a little guilty not always wanting to be out at the beach. It was so great to sit in the sun by the pool and read and relax in our own private space.
reviews.title: Amazing View!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having said that, the beaches on the island are amazing. We went to a bunch of them and had a total of three other people at any time there with us. If you are looking for a quiet and relaxing place, Virgin Gorda is perfect! We love to travel but also love to be in more of the out of the way spots and Virgin Gorda and Nail Bay were just perfect for us.
reviews.title: Great with the Bad

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights in Virgin Gorda in October 2008.
reviews.title: Sugar Mill Villa - Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented the Sugar Mill Villa at Nail Bay Resort. The villa is not on the beach, but it is beautiful, modern, unique, and offers great views of the sea. We LOVED it. The villa can be rented as 2 separate units. We rented the One Bedroom Pool Side Garden Suite which has a first floor and a ground floor.
reviews.title: Island Oasis is a gem

likes.liked: — High quality accomodations, great view, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a couple of issues with the villa. When we arrived, we were told the water pressure was very low and workers were trying to fix the problem. In the meantime, we were offered another villa. We chose to stay at the Sugar Mill since the problem was expected to be resolved in a few hours. Sure enough, when we returned from dinner, the water pressure was back to normal.
reviews.title: Fabulous Resort and Island

likes.liked: — Everything - the grounds, the pool, the accommodations, the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other issue was the smell in the ground floor of the villa. The ground floor is really a basement, so there are no windows. I'm not sure how to explain the smell. It was definitely not an "ewww" odor. Maybe a combination of lack of fresh air and something else?? Even with the fans or the AC on, it didn't help. I was the only one bothered by it though. My husband and son had no problems spending time downstairs.
reviews.title: In one word...Breathtaking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: MOUNTAIN TRUNK BEACH: This is the resort's beach, a short walk from our villa. We found the best snorkeling there (it wasn't great though). We also checked out Spring Bay (loved it - we had it all to ourselves) , The Baths, Savannah Bay, and Mahoe Bay.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Nail Bay the first week of September in 2007. Upon our arrival and throughout the entire 10 days we were the only guests in the hotel. PEFECT planning as part of our retreat is to get away, meet the locals and not deal with tourists who are inexperienced in Caribbean travel.
reviews.title: A Place to Get Away

likes.disliked: — One of the bartenders was kind of boring.

reviews.text: Is Nail Bay a U.S. 5 Start hotel, definitely not, for experienced Caribbean travelers you know there is no such thing unless you want to stay at a resort that is over $750 per night. Since our budget does not allow us to do so we are willing to take Caribbean travel with a “grain of salt”.
reviews.title: Great Property

reviews.text: One of the most entertaining experiences was driving on the pot filled, dirt road that encompassed live chickens and goats. The road was a few miles and you could only drive 15 mph “at best”. The locals were much more adapted to the road and therefore were able to handle the terrain much more aggressively. They were extremely polite and always waved as they passed by.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being the only guests in the hotel enabled us to meet the entire staff and they of course knew us. We were visiting The Baths one afternoon and several were enjoying a day off. When they saw us they invited us to join them for a drink and food which they had brought with them for the day. We were extremely happy with the locals, they did not make you feel like you were invading their territory nor did they make you feel like an outsider.
reviews.title: Fantastic second stay
Nail Bay - Very nice
reviews.text: If you are looking for all the amenities of home than I would stay home. Nail Bay is a relaxing resort with amazing views, the electricity cuts out a couple times a day, the air conditioning is not what it is in the US, and there are bugs. Building in the BVI/USVI is not an easy task as there is not a Home Depot around the corner if you need a couple stacks of wood or a roof repaired. If you have the attitude of going to the resort to slow down, enjoy the view, and relax you will not be disappointed.

description: Once a 19th century sugar plantation, today experience the distinctive 148-acre Nail Bay Estates and Resort. Perched on hillside and framed by three private beaches, this Virgin Gorda resort is situated in the heart of the British Virgin Islands. A resort capturing the antidote to urban life - from a collection of private villas and charming suites, to breathtaking ocean views of the Sir Francis Drake Channel, with affordable luxury to invite guests year after year. Minutes from Virgin Gorda’s renowned attractions including The Baths, and North Sound. Beef Island Airport (EIS)- 22 mi/35km, 35 minutes.
